trans-unit.source: Maintains the run-time state of an <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref> and processes its output values.
AnimationClock objects are generated from <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> objects.
An <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> describes an animation's output values, duration, begin time, end time, and other fundamental animation information.
An AnimationClock processes the animation values described by an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> class.
The animation that describes this clock's output values and timing behaviors.
Gets the current output value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref>.
The origin value provided to the clock if its animation does not have its own start value.
If this clock is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous clock in the chain
The destination value provided to the clock if its animation does not have its own destination value.
If this clock is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous clock in the chain
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref> that describes this clock's behavior.
The animation that describes this clock's behavior.
